intro: Anthistiria ciliata var. brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate saline environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
